qas.question: What was less standardized during the Baroque era?

answers.text: the types of instruments used in ensembles

qas.question: Two violins, a viola, and a cello make up what type of group?
Keyboard instruments included the pip organ, harpsichord and what other instrument?
What is an example of a stringed chordal instrument during the Baroque period?

context: One major difference between Baroque music and the classical era that followed it is that <a0_0>the types of instruments used in ensembles<a0_0/> were much less standardized. Whereas <a1_0>a classical era string quartet<a1_0/> consists almost exclusively of two violins, a viola and a cello, a Baroque group accompanying a soloist or opera could include one of several different types of keyboard instruments (e.g., pipe organ, harpsichord, or <a2_0>clavichord<a2_0/>), additional stringed chordal instruments (e.g., <a3_0>a lute<a3_0/>) and an unspecified number of bass instruments performing the basso continuo bassline, including bowed strings, woodwinds and brass instruments (e.g., a cello, contrabass, viol, bassoon, serpent, etc.).
